t: Luke 13
Call to Repent
Now*p on the same occasion there were some present who reported to Him about the Galileans whose blood Pilate had mixed with their sacrifices.
And Jesus said to them, “Do*r you*r suppose*r that*r these*r Galileans*r were*r greater*ir sinners*r than*r all*r other*ir Galileans*r because*r they*r suffered*r this*r fate?*ir
I*r tell*r you,*r no,*r but*r unless*r you*r repent,*r you*r will*r all*r likewise*r perish.*r

Or*r do*r you*r suppose*r that*r those*r eighteen*r on*r whom*r the*r tower*r in*r Siloam*r fell*r and*r killed*r them*r were*r worse*ir culprits*r than*r all*r the*r men*r who*r live*r in*r Jerusalem?*r
I*r tell*r you,*r no,*r but*r unless*r you*r repent,*r you*r will*r all*r likewise*r perish.”*r

And*p He began*i telling this parable: “A*r man*r had*r a*r fig*r tree*r which*r had*r been*r planted*r in*r his*r vineyard;*r and*r he*r came*r looking*r for*r fruit*r on*r it*r and*r did*r not*r find*r any.*r

And*r he*r said*r to*r the*r vineyard-keeper,*r ‘Behold,*r for*r three*r years*r I*r have*r come*r looking*r for*r fruit*r on*r this*r fig*r tree*r without*r finding*r any.*r Cut*r it*r down!*r Why*r does*r it*r even*r use*r up*r the*r ground?’*r
And*r he*r answered*r and*r said*r to*r him,*r ‘Let*r it*r alone,*r sir,*r for*r this*r year*r too,*r until*r I*r dig*r around*r it*r and*r put*r in*r fertilizer;*r
and*r if*r it*r bears*r fruit*r next*r year,*r fine;*ir but*r if*r not,*r cut*r it*r down.’ ”*r
Healing on the Sabbath
And*p He was teaching in one of the synagogues on the Sabbath.
And there was a woman who for eighteen years had had a sickness caused by a spirit; and she was bent double, and could not straighten up at all.
When Jesus saw her, He called her over and said to her, “Woman,*r you*r are*r freed*r from*r your*r sickness.”*r
And He laid His hands on her; and immediately she was made erect again and began*i glorifying God.

But the synagogue official, indignant because Jesus had healed on the Sabbath, began*i saying to the crowd in response, “There are six days in which work should be done; so come during them and get healed, and not on the Sabbath day.”

But the Lord answered him and said, “You*r hypocrites,*r does*r not*r each*r of*r you*r on*r the*r Sabbath*r untie*r his*r ox*r or*r his*r donkey*r from*r the*r stall*r and*r lead*r him*r away*r to*r water*r him?*ir

And*r this*r woman,*r a*r daughter*r of*r Abraham*r as*r she*r is,*r whom*r Satan*r has*r bound*r for*r eighteen*r long*r years,*r should*r she*r not*r have*r been*r released*r from*r this*r bond*r on*r the*r Sabbath*r day?”*r
As He said this, all His opponents were being humiliated; and the entire crowd was rejoicing over all the glorious things being done by Him.
Parables of Mustard Seed and Leaven
So*p He was saying, “What*r is*r the*r kingdom*r of*r God*r like,*r and*r to*r what*r shall*r I*r compare*r it?*r

It*r is*r like*r a*r mustard*r seed,*r which*r a*r man*r took*r and*r threw*r into*r his*r own*r garden;*r and*r it*r grew*r and*r became*r a*r tree,*r and*r the*sr birds*sr of*sr the*sr air*sr nested*sr in*sr its*sr branches.”*sr
And*p again He said, “To*r what*r shall*r I*r compare*r the*r kingdom*r of*r God?*r
It*r is*r like*r leaven,*r which*r a*r woman*r took*r and*r hid*r in*r three*r pecks*r of*r flour*r until*r it*r was*r all*r leavened.”*r
Teaching in the Villages
And*p He was passing through from one city and village to another, teaching, and proceeding on His way to Jerusalem.
And someone said to Him, “Lord, are there just*i a few who are being saved?” And He said to them,
“Strive*r to*r enter*r through*r the*r narrow*r door;*r for*r many,*r I*r tell*r you,*r will*r seek*r to*r enter*r and*r will*r not*r be*r able.*r

Once*r the*r head*r of*r the*r house*r gets*r up*r and*r shuts*r the*r door,*r and*r you*r begin*r to*r stand*r outside*r and*r knock*r on*r the*r door,*r saying,*r ‘Lord,*r open*r up*r to*r us!’*r then*r He*r will*r answer*r and*r say*r to*r you,*r ‘I*r do*r not*r know*r where*r you*r are*r from.’*r
Then*r you*r will*r begin*r to*r say,*r ‘We*r ate*r and*r drank*r in*r Your*r presence,*r and*r You*r taught*r in*r our*r streets’;*r
and*r He*r will*r say,*r ‘I*r tell*r you,*r I*r do*r not*r know*r where*r you*r are*r from;*r depart*sr from*sr Me,*sr all*sr you*sr evildoers.’*sr

In*r that*r place*r there*r will*r be*r weeping*r and*r gnashing*r of*r teeth*r when*r you*r see*r Abraham*r and*r Isaac*r and*r Jacob*r and*r all*r the*r prophets*r in*r the*r kingdom*r of*r God,*r but*r yourselves*r being*r thrown*r out.*r
And*r they*r will*r come*r from*r east*r and*r west*r and*r from*r north*r and*r south,*r and*r will*r recline*r at*ir the*ir table*ir in*r the*r kingdom*r of*r God.*r
And*r behold,*r some*ir are*r last*r who*r will*r be*r first*r and*r some*ir are*r first*r who*r will*r be*r last.”*r
Just*p at that time some Pharisees approached, saying to Him, “Go away, leave here, for Herod wants to kill You.”
And He said to them, “Go*r and*r tell*r that*r fox,*r ‘Behold,*r I*r cast*r out*r demons*r and*r perform*r cures*r today*r and*r tomorrow,*r and*r the*r third*r day*ir I*r reach*r My*r goal.’*r
Nevertheless*r I*r must*r journey*r on*r today*r and*r tomorrow*r and*r the*r next*r day;*ir for*r it*r cannot*r be*r that*r a*r prophet*r would*r perish*r outside*r of*r Jerusalem.*r

O*r Jerusalem,*r Jerusalem,*r the*ir city*ir that*r kills*r the*r prophets*r and*r stones*r those*r sent*r to*r her!*r How*r often*r I*r wanted*r to*r gather*r your*r children*r together,*r just*r as*r a*r hen*r gathers*ir her*r brood*r under*r her*r wings,*r and*r you*r would*r not*r have*ir it!*ir

Behold,*r your*r house*r is*r left*r to*r you*r desolate;*ir and*r I*r say*r to*r you,*r you*r will*r not*r see*r Me*r until*r the*ir time*ir comes*r when*r you*r say,*r ‘Blessed*sr is*sr He*sr who*sr comes*sr in*sr the*sr name*sr of*sr the*sr Lord*sr !’ ”*r
